intro: Buchnera nordestina, commonly known as the Brazilian leafy spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is adapted to thrive in humid tropical climates. Buchnera nordestina plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
